alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 2:36PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following counties, Pulaski and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 234 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is expected through 545 PM. This will lead to minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Somerset, Burnside, Quinton, General Burnside S.P., Bronston, Tateville, Kidder, Sloans Valley, Elihu, Somerset Pulaski Airport, Delta, Betsey, Gregory, Ruth, Grade, Bent, Barrier, Oil Valley and Ferguson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
